name: NPR
text:
In Montgomery, Ohio, the annual Fourth of July parade is a long honored tradition.

To keep it up during the pandemic, they've decided to do a "reverse parade" this year — where the units are stationery and the spectators drive through.
https://t.co/I9Acpwlpk3

name: NPR
text:
Photographer Salgu Wissmath says gender dysphoria is "sorely misunderstood by society."

Using deeply intimate portraits, they set out to document some of the experiences of trans and nonbinary people — through a queer lens.
https://t.co/HvkaRauRLJ
